articles.title: How overflow: clip Works in CSS
articles.description: This is a solid look at using the well-supported clip value alongside the overflow CSS property ‚Äî with some good example use cases, particularly around art direction.
articles.author: Ahmad Shadeed

articles.title: Meet Angular v19
articles.description: The latest version of this popular web app framework is here ‚Äî to mark the release ‚ñ∂Ô∏è here‚Äôs a video running through what new features you can expect.

articles.title: Importing a Frontend JavaScript Library Without a Build System
articles.description: Julia explores how to import a JS library when taking a no-build-system approach.
articles.author: Julia Evans

articles.title: alt Text: Don‚Äôt Just Describe Images
articles.description: Advice for writing alt text that communicates an image‚Äôs purpose without repeating page content ‚Äî chiefly focus on meaning rather than visual description.
articles.author: Emma Cionca & Tanner Kohler

articles.title: Creating an ASCII Shader Using OGL
articles.description: This is an incredibly cool effect, not to mention great tutorial on getting started with shaders and using OGL, a minimal WebGL library that‚Äôs a lot lighter than Three.js.

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†Nerd Show and Tell: Meet Zach Leatherman

articles.title: SVG to Font 6.1: Read SVG Icons and Output a Font File
articles.description: Both a CLI tool and Node.js library that can read in SVG documents and output WOFF2, WOFF, EOT, TTF and SVG fonts. Useful for generating a Web font from a set of icons, say, as in this demo.

articles.title: lite-youtube Web Component v1.6 Released
articles.description: The latest version of this web component that quickly renders YouTube embeds adds auto-pausing, custom CSS properties, named slot thumbnails, and more.

articles.title: SmarkForm: A Library for Creating Markup-Driven and Extendable Forms in Web Apps
articles.description: This allows you to add advanced features to forms, like JSON import/export, hotkeys, along with other interactive enhancements. Try some examples here.

articles.title: Coding Font: A 'Game' to Find Your New Favorite Code Font
articles.description: This is a fun idea. It throws over 25 popular developer-oriented fonts into a ‚Äòtournament‚Äô and you then pick your favorites until you‚Äôre left with a winner. (It was Cousine for me.)

articles.title: Monicon: A Universal Icon Library for Any JavaScript Framework
articles.description: The project itself is not new, but provides quick access to 200,000+ icons from popular sets and works with most frameworks and build tools.
